summary: This bill, H.R. 3457, amends the Food Security Act of 1985 to establish a feral swine eradication and control program. The Secretary of Agriculture is tasked with studying the damage caused by feral swine, developing methods for their eradication and control, and providing financial assistance to agricultural producers. The bill outlines the duties of the Secretary, coordination with agencies like the Natural Resources Conservation Service and Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS), and contracts with land-grant colleges/universities. Funding will be allocated between the NRCS and APHIS, and the bill repeals the related Section 2408 of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018.
